channel.title: Findings on UVA Biocomplexity Institute
channel.description: Recent content in Findings on UVA Biocomplexity Institute

item.title: General Project Overview
item.description: While this page is optional, it probably makes sense to have one weighted at the top (see the front matter at the top of this Rmd file) that gives a general overview of the project. This could be something like the final poster while the other pages highlight more in-depth observations. Here is a general schema of what should be covered throughout your website: Main Findings [Here you will describe the results and include important visualizations from your project.

item.title: Data Profiling and Benchmarking
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3 { text-align: center; } Examples Page If you want to add in an image on an Rmd file, use this link here. It ends up being a little tricky, but as long as you have created a folder to insert your images, you can just use some markdown code or html to insert images in the format you want.

item.title: Sequence Exploration
item.description: Exploring veteran's whole career sequences After cleaning the BGT data, we created our sequence objects using TraMineR. To begin, we created a sequence object using the whole career of veterans. This yielded 8,068 sequences of varying lengths. When creating the whole career sequence object, we defined eight unique states: Zone 1, Zone 2, Zone 3, Zone 4, Zone 5, Missing zone, Military, and Unemployed.

item.title: Sequence Clustering
item.description: In the previous Sequence Exploration, we introduced the following sequence state naming system, shown in Table 1. {"x":{"filter":"none","data":[["Zone 1","Zone 2","Zone 3","Zone 4","Zone 5","Missing zone","Military","Unemployed","Military transition unemployed","Civilian unemployed","Retired"],["Z1","Z2","Z3","Z4","Z5","MISSING","MILITARY","UNEMP","TR UNEMP","CV UNEMP","RETIRED"],["O*NET SOC Code","O*NET SOC Code","O*NET SOC Code","O*NET SOC Code","O*NET SOC Code","O*NET SOC Code","O*NET SOC Code","seqdef() gaps =","seqdef() left =","seqdef() gaps =","seqdef() right ="],["Job Zones group occupations into one of five categories based on levels of education, experience, and training necessary to perform the occupation.
